content.description: An engineer wanted to investigate the relationship between total stopping distance required (reaction distance and actual breaking distance) and speed of a car. The engineer completed an experiment measuring the total stopping distance of the car at <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> different speeds, and the resulting regression output is shown below.
content.question: Predictor <math alttext="Coefficient" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Coef</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="Standard Error" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>SE</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="Coefficient" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Coef</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>T</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Constant <math alttext="negative 284.29" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>284.29</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="63.032" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>63.032</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="negative 4.51" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4.51</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.0204" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0204</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Speed <math alttext="11.905" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11.905</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="1.220" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.220</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="9.76" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>9.76</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="0.0023" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0023</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="S equals 35.56" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>S</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>35.56</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R square equals 96.9%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R-sq</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>96.9</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="R square, adjusted, equals 95.9%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R-sq (adj)</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>95.9</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> Assume the conditions for inference are met. Which of the following represents a <math alttext="95" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence interval for the slope of the regression line?

choices.label: <math alttext="11.905 plus or minus, 3.182 times the fraction 1.220 over the square root of 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11.905</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>3.182</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.220</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="11.905 plus or minus, 3.182 times the fraction 1.220 over the square root of 4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11.905</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>3.182</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.220</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="11.905 plus or minus, 2.776 times the fraction 1.220, over the square root of 5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11.905</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.776</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1.220</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.2: Confidence Intervals for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
